Events.RelatedBody: Also add this text after the request for details sentence for safety violations: ‚ÄúPlease also describe where in the package the problem was found.‚Äù

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[DCR]: Unify GetInstalledAndTransitivePackagesAsync() in CpsPackageRefereneProject and LegacyPackageReferenceProject." (#11397) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Affected

Visual Studio Package Management UI, Visual Studio Package Manager Console

### Current Behavior

There are two different implementations of GetInstalledAndTransitivePackagesAsync() method in CpsPackageRefereneProject and LegacyPackageReferenceProject classes. 



### Desired Behavior

The goal of this issue is to refactor those classes and have a common implementation of GetInstalledAndTransitivePackagesAsync , since those methods are mostly the same. Main difference is that Legacy PR does not support multitargeting. CpsPackageRefereneProject  does support multitargetting

### Additional Context

This is part of https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/4119

Comment: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/4119#discussion_r733184429

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue ""nuget sources add" does not support setting NuGet API version" (#11396) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/nuget-sources-add-does-not-support-set/1585758)._ --- [severity:It's more difficult to complete my work] When running "nuget sources add" command, it does not support setting NuGet API version. There should be an option to set the "protocolVersion" parameter in the NuGet.Config file that is written. The only workaround is to manually edit the config file, but is shared build servers and hard to automate. --- ### Original Comments #### Feedback Bot on 11/17/2021, 01:02 AM:

We have directed your feedback to the appropriate engineering team for further evaluation. The team will review the feedback and notify you about the next steps.

--- ### Original Solutions (no solutions)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Feature]: Provide informative UI element for new Custom Versions combobox" (#11395) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Involved

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### The Elevator Pitch

In https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/4339, the PM UI version combobox is made to be capable of typing custom versions, as part of https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/9829. 

My suggestion is to add something near this combobox, such as ‚ÑπÔ∏è, with text and/or hyperlinks to documentation explaining what values may be entered into this box, and how they behave.

Goal: discoverability and clarity of the feature's capabilities.

### Additional Context and Details

_No response_
